column.name: feat_name
column.value: Acrobatic [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Jump checks and Tumble checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Agile [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Balance checks and Escape Artist checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Alertness [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Listen checks and Spot checks.

column.name: special
column.value: The master of a familiar gains the benefit of the Alertness feat whenever the familiar is within arm�s reach.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Animal Affinity [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Handle Animal checks and Ride checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Armor Proficiency (Heavy) [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Armor Proficiency (light), Armor Proficiency (medium).

column.name: benefit
column.value: See Armor Proficiency (light).

column.name: normal
column.value: See Armor Proficiency (light).

column.name: special
column.value: Fighters, paladins, and clerics automatically have Armor Proficiency (heavy) as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Armor Proficiency (Light) [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you wear a type of armor with which you are proficient, the armor check penalty for that armor applies only to Balance, Climb, Escape Artist, Hide, Jump, Move Silently, Sleight of Hand, and Tumble checks.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character who is wearing armor with which she is not proficient applies its armor check penalty to attack rolls and to all skill checks that involve moving, including Ride.

column.name: special
column.value: All characters except wizards, sorcerers, and monks automatically have Armor Proficiency (light) as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Armor Proficiency (Medium) [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: See Armor Proficiency (light).

column.name: normal
column.value: See Armor Proficiency (light).

column.name: special
column.value: Fighters, barbarians, paladins, clerics, druids, and bards automatically have Armor Proficiency (medium) as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Athletic [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Climb checks and Swim checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Augment Summoning [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Each creature you conjure with any summon spell gains a +4 enhancement bonus to Strength and Constitution for the duration of the spell that summoned it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Blind-Fight [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: In melee, every time you miss because of concealment, you can reroll your miss chance percentile roll one time to see if you actually hit.

column.name: normal
column.value: Regular attack roll modifiers for invisible attackers trying to hit you apply, and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC. The speed reduction for darkness and poor visibility also applies.

column.name: special
column.value: The Blind-Fight feat is of no use against a character who is the subject of a blink spell.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Brew Potion [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create a potion of any 3rd-level or lower spell that you know and that targets one or more creatures. Brewing a potion takes one day. When you create a potion, you set the caster level, which must be sufficient to cast the spell in question and no higher than your own level. The base price of a potion is its spell level � its caster level � 50 gp. To brew a potion, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one half this base price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Cleave [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Str 13, Power Attack.

column.name: benefit
column.value: If you deal a creature enough damage to make it drop (typically by dropping it to below 0 hit points or killing it), you get an immediate, extra melee attack against another creature within reach. You cannot take a 5-foot step before making this extra attack. The extra attack is with the same weapon and at the same bonus as the attack that dropped the previous creature. You can use this ability once per round.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Cleave as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Combat Casting [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +4 bonus on Concentration checks made to cast a spell or use a spell-like ability while on the defensive or while you are grappling or pinned.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Combat Expertise [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you use the attack action or the full attack action in melee, you can take a penalty of as much as -5 on your attack roll and add the same number (+5 or less) as a dodge bonus to your Armor Class. This number may not exceed your base attack bonus. The changes to attack rolls and Armor Class last until your next action.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character without the Combat Expertise feat can fight defensively while using the attack or full attack action to take a -4 penalty on attack rolls and gain a +2 dodge bonus to Armor Class.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Combat Expertise as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Combat Reflexes [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You may make a number of additional attacks of opportunity equal to your Dexterity bonus.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character without this feat can make only one attack of opportunity per round and can�t make attacks of opportunity while flat-footed.

column.name: special
column.value: The Combat Reflexes feat does not allow a rogue to use her opportunist ability more than once per round.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Craft Magic Arms And Armor [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create any magic weapon, armor, or shield whose prerequisites you meet. Enhancing a weapon, suit of armor, or shield takes one day for each 1,000 gp in the price of its magical features. To enhance a weapon, suit of armor, or shield, you must spend 1/25 of its features� total price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of this total price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Craft Rod [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create any rod whose prerequisites you meet. Crafting a rod takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a rod, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of its base price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Craft Staff [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create any staff whose prerequisites you meet.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Craft Wand [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create a wand of any 4th-level or lower spell that you know. Crafting a wand takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. The base price of a wand is its caster level � the spell level � 750 gp. To craft a wand, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of this base price. A newly created wand has 50 charges.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Craft Wondrous Item [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create any wondrous item whose prerequisites you meet. Enchanting a wondrous item takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its price. To enchant a wondrous item, you must spend 1/25 of the item�s price in XP and use up raw materials costing half of this price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Deceitful [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Disguise checks and Forgery checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Deflect Arrows [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Improved Unarmed Strike.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat. Once per round when you would normally be hit with a ranged weapon, you may deflect it so that you take no damage from it. You must be aware of the attack and not flat-footed.

column.name: special
column.value: A monk may select Deflect Arrows as a bonus feat at 2nd level, even if she does not meet the prerequisites.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Deft Hands [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Sleight of Hand checks and Use Rope checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Diehard [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When reduced to between -1 and -9 hit points, you automatically become stable. You don�t have to roll d% to see if you lose 1 hit point each round.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character without this feat who is reduced to between -1 and -9 hit points is unconscious and dying.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Diligent [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Appraise checks and Decipher Script checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Dodge [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: During your action, you designate an opponent and receive a +1 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks from that opponent. You can select a new opponent on any action.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Dodge as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Empower Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: All variable, numeric effects of an empowered spell are increased by one-half.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Endurance [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage, Constitution checks made to continue running, Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march, Constitution checks made to hold your breath, Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from starvation or thirst, Fortitude saves made to avoid nonlethal damage from hot or cold environments, and Fortitude saves made to resist damage from suffocation. Also, you may sleep in light or medium armor without becoming fatigued.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character without this feat who sleeps in medium or heavier armor is automatically fatigued the next day.

column.name: special
column.value: A ranger automatically gains Endurance as a bonus feat at 3rd level. He need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Enlarge Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to increase its range by 100%. An enlarged spell with a range of close now has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./level, while medium-range spells have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and long-range spells have a range of 800 ft. + 80 ft./level. An enlarged spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell�s actual level.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Eschew Materials [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can cast any spell that has a material component costing 1 gp or less without needing that component. (The casting of the spell still provokes attacks of opportunity as normal.) If the spell requires a material component that costs more than 1 gp, you must have the material component at hand to cast the spell, just as normal.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Exotic Weapon Proficiency [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You make attack rolls with the weapon normally.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character who uses a weapon with which he or she is not proficient takes a -4 penalty on attack rolls.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Exotic Weapon Proficiency multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of exotic weapon. Proficiency with the bastard sword or the dwarven waraxe has an additional prerequisite of Str 13.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Extend Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: An extended spell lasts twice as long as normal. A spell with a duration of concentration, instantaneous, or permanent is not affected by this feat. An extended spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell�s actual level.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Extra Turning [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Each time you take this feat, you can use your ability to turn or rebuke creatures four more times per day than normal.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, a character can typically turn or rebuke undead (or other creatures) a number of times per day equal to 3 + his or her Charisma modifier.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Extra Turning multiple times. Its effects stack. Each time you take the feat, you can use each of your turning or rebuking abilities four additional times per day.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Far Shot [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you use a projectile weapon, such as a bow, its range increment increases by one-half (multiply by 1?). When you use a thrown weapon, its range increment is doubled.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Far Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Forge Ring [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create any ring whose prerequisites you meet. Crafting a ring takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To craft a ring, you must spend 1/25 of its base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of its base price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Great Cleave [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Str 13, Cleave, Power Attack, base attack bonus +4.

column.name: benefit
column.value: This feat works like Cleave, except that there is no limit to the number of times you can use it per round.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Great Cleave as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Great Fortitude [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Fortitude saving throws.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Greater Spell Focus [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select. This bonus stacks with the bonus from Spell Focus.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic to which you already have applied the Spell Focus feat.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Greater Spell Penetration [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature�s spell resistance. This bonus stacks with the one from Spell Penetration.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Greater Two-Weapon Fighting [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 19, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a third attack with your off-hand weapon, albeit at a -10 penalty. See the Two-Weapon Fighting special attack.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Greater Two-Weapon Fighting as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Greater Weapon Focus [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, fighter level 8th.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on attack rolls, including the one from Weapon Focus (see below).

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Greater Weapon Focus multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Greater Weapon Specialization [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Proficiency with selected weapon, Greater Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, Weapon Specialization with selected weapon, fighter level 12th.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon. This bonus stacks with other bonuses on damage rolls, including the one from Weapon Specialization (see below).

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Greater Weapon Specialization multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Heighten Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: A heightened spell has a higher spell level than normal (up to a maximum of 9th level). Unlike other metamagic feats, Heighten Spell actually increases the effective level of the spell that it modifies. All effects dependent on spell level (such as saving throw DCs and ability to penetrate a lesser globe of invulnerability) are calculated according to the heightened level. The heightened spell is as difficult to prepare and cast as a spell of its effective level.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Bull Rush [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Str 13, Power Attack.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you perform a bull rush you do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the defender. You also gain a +4 bonus on the opposed Strength check you make to push back the defender.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Bull Rush as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Counterspell [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When counterspelling, you may use a spell of the same school that is one or more spell levels higher than the target spell.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you may counter a spell only with the same spell or with a spell specifically designated as countering the target spell.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Critical [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When using the weapon you selected, your threat range is doubled.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Improved Critical multiple times. The effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Disarm [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to disarm an opponent, nor does the opponent have a chance to disarm you. You also gain a +4 bonus on the opposed attack roll you make to disarm your opponent.

column.name: normal
column.value: See the normal disarm rules.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Disarm as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Familiar [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Ability to acquire a new familiar, compatible alignment, sufficiently high level (see below).

column.name: benefit
column.value: When choosing a familiar, the creatures listed below are also available to the spellcaster. The spellcaster may choose a familiar with an alignment up to one step away on each of the alignment axes (lawful through chaotic, good through evil).

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Feint [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can make a Bluff check to feint in combat as a move action.

column.name: normal
column.value: Feinting in combat is a standard action.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Grapple [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Improved Unarmed Strike.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you make a touch attack to start a grapple. You also gain a +4 bonus on all grapple checks, regardless of whether you started the grapple.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you make a touch attack to start a grapple.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Grapple as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Initiative [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +4 bonus on initiative checks.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Initiative as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Overrun [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Str 13, Power Attack.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you attempt to overrun an opponent, the target may not choose to avoid you. You also gain a +4 bonus on your Strength check to knock down your opponent.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, the target of an overrun can choose to avoid you or to block you.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Overrun as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Precise Shot [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 19, Point Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +11.

column.name: benefit
column.value: Your ranged attacks ignore the AC bonus granted to targets by anything less than total cover, and the miss chance granted to targets by anything less than total concealment. Total cover and total concealment provide their normal benefits against your ranged attacks.

column.name: normal
column.value: See the normal rules on the effects of cover and concealment. Without this feat, a character who shoots or throws a ranged weapon at a target involved in a grapple must roll randomly to see which grappling combatant the attack strikes.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Precise Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Shield Bash [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you perform a shield bash, you may still apply the shield�s shield bonus to your AC.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, a character who performs a shield bash loses the shield�s shield bonus to AC until his or her next turn.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Shield Bash as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Sunder [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Str 13, Power Attack.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you strike at an object held or carried by an opponent (such as a weapon or shield), you do not provoke an attack of opportunity.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you strike at an object held or carried by another character.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Sunder as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Trip [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Int 13, Combat Expertise.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You do not provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to trip an opponent while you are unarmed. You also gain a +4 bonus on your Strength check to trip your opponent.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you provoke an attack of opportunity when you attempt to trip an opponent while you are unarmed.

column.name: special
column.value: At 6th level, a monk may select Improved Trip as a bonus feat, even if she does not have the prerequisites.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Turning [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You turn or rebuke creatures as if you were one level higher than you are in the class that grants you the ability.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Two-Weapon Fighting [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 17, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

column.name: benefit
column.value: In addition to the standard single extra attack you get with an off-hand weapon, you get a second attack with it, albeit at a -5 penalty. See the Two-Weapon Fighting special attack.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you can only get a single extra attack with an off-hand weapon.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Improved Two-Weapon Fighting as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Improved Unarmed Strike [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You are considered to be armed even when unarmed �that is, you do not provoke attacks or opportunity from armed opponents when you attack them while unarmed. However, you still get an attack of opportunity against any opponent who makes an unarmed attack on you.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you are considered unarmed when attacking with an unarmed strike, and you can deal only nonlethal damage with such an attack.

column.name: special
column.value: A monk automatically gains Improved Unarmed Strike as a bonus feat at 1st level. She need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Investigator [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Gather Information checks and Search checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Iron Will [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Will saving throws.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Leadership [General]

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Lightning Reflexes [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Reflex saving throws.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Magical Aptitude [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Spellcraft checks and Use Magic Device checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Manyshot [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 17, Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, base attack bonus +6

column.name: benefit
column.value: As a standard action, you may fire two arrows at a single opponent within 30 feet. Both arrows use the same attack roll (with a -4 penalty) to determine success and deal damage normally (but see Special).

column.name: special
column.value: Regardless of the number of arrows you fire, you apply precision-based damage only once. If you score a critical hit, only the first arrow fired deals critical damage; all others deal regular damage.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Martial Weapon Proficiency [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You make attack rolls with the selected weapon normally.

column.name: normal
column.value: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a -4 penalty on attack rolls.

column.name: special
column.value: Barbarians, fighters, paladins, and rangers are proficient with all martial weapons. They need not select this feat.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Maximize Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. A maximized spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell�s actual level.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Mobility [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Dodge.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +4 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a threatened area. A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Mobility as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Mounted Archery [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

column.name: benefit
column.value: The penalty you take when using a ranged weapon while mounted is halved: -2 instead of -4 if your mount is taking a double move, and -4 instead of -8 if your mount is running.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Mounted Archery as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Mounted Combat [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Once per round when your mount is hit in combat, you may attempt a Ride check (as a reaction) to negate the hit. The hit is negated if your Ride check result is greater than the opponent�s attack roll. (Essentially, the Ride check result becomes the mount�s Armor Class if it�s higher than the mount�s regular AC.)

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Mounted Combat as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Natural Spell [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Wis 13, wild shape ability.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can complete the verbal and somatic components of spells while in a wild shape. You substitute various noises and gestures for the normal verbal and somatic components of a spell.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Negotiator [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Diplomacy checks and Sense Motive checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Nimble Fingers [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Disable Device checks and Open Lock checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Persuasive [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Bluff checks and Intimidate checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Point Blank Shot [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Point Blank Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Power Attack [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: On your action, before making attack rolls for a round, you may choose to subtract a number from all melee attack rolls and add the same number to all melee damage rolls. This number may not exceed your base attack bonus. The penalty on attacks and bonus on damage apply until your next turn.

column.name: special
column.value: If you attack with a two-handed weapon, or with a one-handed weapon wielded in two hands, instead add twice the number subtracted from your attack rolls. You can�t add the bonus from Power Attack to the damage dealt with a light weapon (except with unarmed strikes or natural weapon attacks), even though the penalty on attack rolls still applies. (Normally, you treat a double weapon as a one-handed weapon and a light weapon. If you choose to use a double weapon like a two-handed weapon, attacking with only one end of it in a round, you treat it as a two-handed weapon.)

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Precise Shot [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard -4 penalty on your attack roll.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Precise Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Quick Draw [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can draw a weapon as a free action instead of as a move action. You can draw a hidden weapon (see the Sleight of Hand skill) as a move action.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you may draw a weapon as a move action, or (if your base attack bonus is +1 or higher) as a free action as part of movement. Without this feat, you can draw a hidden weapon as a standard action.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Quick Draw as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Quicken Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Casting a quickened spell is an swift action. You can perform another action, even casting another spell, in the same round as you cast a quickened spell. You may cast only one quickened spell per round. A spell whose casting time is more than 1 full round action cannot be quickened. A quickened spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell�s actual level. Casting a quickened spell doesn�t provoke an attack of opportunity.

column.name: special
column.value: This feat can�t be applied to any spell cast spontaneously (including sorcerer spells, bard spells, and cleric or druid spells cast spontaneously), since applying a metamagic feat to a spontaneously cast spell automatically increases the casting time to a full-round action.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Rapid Reload [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: The time required for you to reload your chosen type of crossbow is reduced to a free action (for a hand or light crossbow) or a move action (for a heavy crossbow). Reloading a crossbow still provokes an attack of opportunity.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character without this feat needs a move action to reload a hand or light crossbow, or a full-round action to reload a heavy crossbow.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain Rapid Reload multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of crossbow.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Rapid Shot [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Point Blank Shot.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can get one extra attack per round with a ranged weapon. The attack is at your highest base attack bonus, but each attack you make in that round (the extra one and the normal ones) takes a -2 penalty. You must use the full attack action to use this feat.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Rapid Shot as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Ride-By Attack [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you are mounted and use the charge action, you may move and attack as if with a standard charge and then move again (continuing the straight line of the charge). Your total movement for the round can�t exceed double your mounted speed. You and your mount do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the opponent that you attack.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Ride-By Attack as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Run [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: When running, you move five times your normal speed (if wearing medium, light, or no armor and carrying no more than a medium load) or four times your speed (if wearing heavy armor or carrying a heavy load). If you make a jump after a running start (see the Jump skill description), you gain a +4 bonus on your Jump check. While running, you retain your Dexterity bonus to AC.

column.name: normal
column.value: You move four times your speed while running (if wearing medium, light, or no armor and carrying no more than a medium load) or three times your speed (if wearing heavy armor or carrying a heavy load), and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Scribe Scroll [Item Creation]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know. Scribing a scroll takes one day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. The base price of a scroll is its spell level � its caster level � 25 gp. To scribe a scroll, you must spend 1/25 of this base price in XP and use up raw materials costing one-half of this base price.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Self-Sufficient [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Heal checks and Survival checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Shield Proficiency [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can use a shield and take only the standard penalties.

column.name: normal
column.value: When you are using a shield with which you are not proficient, you take the shield�s armor check penalty on attack rolls and on all skill checks that involve moving, including Ride checks.

column.name: special
column.value: Barbarians, bards, clerics, druids, fighters, paladins, and rangers automatically have Shield Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Shot On The Run [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Point Blank Shot, base attack bonus +4.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When using the attack action with a ranged weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Shot on the Run as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Silent Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: A silent spell can be cast with no verbal components. Spells without verbal components are not affected. A silent spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell�s actual level.

column.name: special
column.value: Bard spells cannot be enhanced by this metamagic feat.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Simple Weapon Proficiency [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You make attack rolls with simple weapons normally.

column.name: normal
column.value: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a -4 penalty on attack rolls.

column.name: special
column.value: All characters except for druids, monks, and wizards are automatically proficient with all simple weapons. They need not select this feat.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Skill Focus [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +3 bonus on all checks involving that skill.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new skill.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Snatch Arrows [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 15, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When using the Deflect Arrows feat you may catch the weapon instead of just deflecting it. Thrown weapons can immediately be thrown back at the original attacker (even though it isn�t your turn) or kept for later use.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Snatch Arrows as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Spell Focus [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Spell Mastery [Special]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Each time you take this feat, choose a number of spells equal to your Intelligence modifier that you already know. From that point on, you can prepare these spells without referring to a spellbook.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you must use a spellbook to prepare all your spells, except read magic.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Spell Penetration [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature�s spell resistance.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Spirited Charge [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Ride-By Attack.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When mounted and using the charge action, you deal double damage with a melee weapon (or triple damage with a lance).

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Spirited Charge as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Spring Attack [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, base attack bonus +4.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When using the attack action with a melee weapon, you can move both before and after the attack, provided that your total distance moved is not greater than your speed. Moving in this way does not provoke an attack of opportunity from the defender you attack, though it might provoke attacks of opportunity from other creatures, if appropriate. You can�t use this feat if you are wearing heavy armor.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Spring Attack as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Stealthy [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You get a +2 bonus on all Hide checks and Move Silently checks.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Still Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: A stilled spell can be cast with no somatic components.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Stunning Fist [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by your unarmed attack to make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + ? your character level + your Wis modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 round (until just before your next action). A stunned creature drops everything held, can�t take actions, takes a -2 penalty to AC, and loses his Dexterity bonus to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round. Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, incorporeal creatures, and creatures immune to critical hits cannot be stunned.

column.name: special
column.value: A monk may select Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if she does not meet the prerequisites. A monk who selects this feat may attempt a stunning attack a number of times per day equal to her monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels she has in classes other than monk.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Toughness [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain +3 hit points.

column.name: special
column.value: A character may gain this feat multiple times. Its effects stack.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Tower Shield Proficiency [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can use a tower shield and suffer only the standard penalties.

column.name: normal
column.value: A character who is using a shield with which he or she is not proficient takes the shield�s armor check penalty on attack rolls and on all skill checks that involve moving, including Ride.

column.name: special
column.value: Fighters automatically have Tower Shield Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Track [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: To find tracks or to follow them for 1 mile requires a successful Survival check. You must make another Survival check every time the tracks become difficult to follow.

column.name: normal
column.value: Without this feat, you can use the Survival skill to find tracks, but you can follow them only if the DC for the task is 10 or lower. Alternatively, you can use the Search skill to find a footprint or similar sign of a creature�s passage using the DCs given above, but you can�t use Search to follow tracks, even if someone else has already found them.

column.name: special
column.value: A ranger automatically has Track as a bonus feat. He need not select it.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Trample [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you attempt to overrun an opponent while mounted, your target may not choose to avoid you. Your mount may make one hoof attack against any target you knock down, gaining the standard +4 bonus on attack rolls against prone targets.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Trample as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Two-Weapon Defense [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 15, Two-Weapon Fighting.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When wielding a double weapon or two weapons (not including natural weapons or unarmed strikes), you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC. See the Two-Weapon Fighting special attack.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Two-Weapon Defense as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Two-Weapon Fighting [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: Your penalties on attack rolls for fighting with two weapons are reduced. The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6. See the Two-Weapon Fighting special attack.

column.name: normal
column.value: If you wield a second weapon in your off hand, you can get one extra attack per round with that weapon. When fighting in this way you suffer a -6 penalty with your regular attack or attacks with your primary hand and a -10 penalty to the attack with your off hand. If your off-hand weapon is light the penalties are reduced by 2 each. (An unarmed strike is always considered light.)

column.name: special
column.value: A 2nd-level ranger who has chosen the two-weapon combat style is treated as having Two-Weapon Fighting, even if he does not have the prerequisite for it, but only when he is wearing light or no armor.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Weapon Finesse [General]

column.name: benefit
column.value: With a light weapon, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls. If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Weapon Finesse as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Weapon Focus [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Proficiency with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Weapon Specialization [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, fighter level 4th.

column.name: benefit
column.value: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.

column.name: special
column.value: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Whirlwind Attack [General]

column.name: prerequisites
column.value: Dex 13, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +4.

column.name: benefit
column.value: When you use the full attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your full base attack bonus against each opponent within reach.

column.name: special
column.value: A fighter may select Whirlwind Attack as one of his fighter bonus feats.

column.name: feat_name
column.value: Widen Spell [Metamagic]

column.name: benefit
column.value: You can alter a burst, emanation, line, or spread shaped spell to increase its area. Any numeric measurements of the spell�s area increase by 100%.A widened spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell�s actual level.
